unnormalised: I'm looking to buy a flat in Mumbai. What are some things I should keep in mind regarding the numbers involved?
normalised: Well, there's quite a bit to consider! First, understand the area of the flat. Builders often quote the "super built-up area", which might be, say, one thousand two hundred square feet, but the actual usable area (carpet area) could be much less, perhaps only eight hundred square feet. Clarify what you're paying for; pay based on carpet area only if possible. The rate per square foot is key, so negotiate hard! Don't just look at the base price of, say, rupee one point five crore.

These can add a hefty sum on top of that one point five crore.
